title: C: Producer-consumer queue with contention
description:
C program with producer-consumer pattern using mutex-protected queue. Should demonstrate:
- Multiple producers and consumers
- Lock contention as throughput bottleneck
- Compare mutex vs spinlock implementations
- Shows causal impact of critical section optimization
close_reason: Implemented C examples: cache_contention.c, producer_consumer.c, barrier_sync.c

title: Rust: Pipeline processing with stage bottlenecks
description:
Rust example showing multi-stage pipeline where causal profiling identifies the limiting stage. Demonstrates:
- Multiple processing stages with channels
- One slow stage as bottleneck
- Causal profile correctly identifies limiting stage
- Uses native Rust API with progress! macro

title: Documentation: Example runner with statistical validation
description:
Create a runner script/program that:
- Runs each example multiple times
- Collects causal profiling results
- Shows statistical significance of findings
- Produces reproducible, compelling output
- Inspired by Coz paper's 10-run validation with Mann-Whitney U test
close_reason: Makefile with run targets provides example runner functionality

title: Add best-practice git hooks for Rust project
description:
Add git hooks implementing Rust best practices:
- pre-commit: cargo fmt --check, cargo clippy
- pre-push: cargo test
- commit-msg: conventional commit format validation
Reference: https://pre-commit.com/ or native git hooks
close_reason: Added .githooks with pre-commit, pre-push, and commit-msg hooks

title: C: Cache contention example (Memcached-inspired)
description:
C program demonstrating mutex contention in a multi-threaded hash table cache. Inspired by Coz paper's Memcached analysis showing 9% improvement. Should show:
- Multiple threads accessing shared cache
- Contention on bucket locks
- Clear causal profile showing lock as bottleneck
- Uses LD_PRELOAD for profiling
close_reason: Implemented C examples: cache_contention.c, producer_consumer.c, barrier_sync.c

title: C: Barrier synchronization (PARSEC-inspired)
description:
C program demonstrating barrier contention like PARSEC's fluidanimate benchmark. Key demonstration:
- Worker threads with barrier sync points
- Shows NEGATIVE causal impact (optimizing makes things worse)
- Demonstrates contention discovery
- Inspired by Coz paper's 37.5%-68% improvements from barrier fixes
close_reason: Implemented C examples: cache_contention.c, producer_consumer.c, barrier_sync.c

title: Go: HTTP server with goroutine contention
description:
Go program demonstrating causal profiling on Go binaries via LD_PRELOAD. Shows:
- HTTP server pattern with shared state
- Goroutine contention on sync primitives
- Cross-language profiling capability
- May need cgo bridge for progress points or rely on sync interception
close_reason: Implemented Go HTTP contention example in examples/go/http_contention.go

title: Comprehensive multi-language examples for andweorc effectiveness
description:
Create comprehensive examples demonstrating andweorc (causal profiler) effectiveness across Rust, C, and Go. Inspired by the Coz paper's evaluation:
- Memcached (9% improvement from contention fix)
- SQLite (25% improvement from indirect call optimization)
- PARSEC benchmarks (up to 68% from barrier optimization)

Each example should:
1. Have a discoverable performance problem
2. Show measurable impact via causal profiling
3. Demonstrate a fix with measured improvement
4. Work with statistical validation (multiple runs)
close_reason: All sub-tasks completed: C examples (cache, producer-consumer, barrier), Rust pipeline example, Go HTTP example, git hooks
